metadata.Title: CVE-2005-1513 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Integer overflow in the stralloc_readyplus function in qmail, when running on 64 bit platforms with a large amount of virtual memory, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via a large SMTP request. It was discovered that netqmail did not properly handle certain input. Both remote and local attackers could use this vulnerability to cause netqmail to crash or execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: netqmail: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
